meanings.definition: An officer in charge of managing the household of a monarch or noble.
meanings.sent1: The chamberlain ensured the royal household ran smoothly.
meanings.sent2: The chamberlain of the castle oversaw the daily operations.
meanings.sent3: The chamberlain accidentally mixed up the king's socks with the queen's.
meanings.sent4: The chamberlain's role was like a conductor orchestrating the royal affairs.
meanings.sent5: Every noble knew the chamberlain by his impeccable organization skills.

meanings.definition: A person who manages the household of a public building or institution.
meanings.sent1: The school's chamberlain was responsible for maintenance and cleanliness.
meanings.sent2: The hospital chamberlain ensured all rooms were well-kept.
meanings.sent3: The chamberlain at the library was known for his love of organizing books.
meanings.sent4: She ran the community center like a diligent chamberlain of a grand estate.
meanings.sent5: The chamberlain of the museum kept every exhibit in perfect order.
